name: Clin T
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Invasive tumor confined to one of the following subsites: 
     Anterior wall including vallecula 
         One lateral wall (including tonsillar pillar/fossa,      palatine tonsil, tonsil, NOS)
         Posterior wall 
     Base of tongue (including lingual tonsil)
     Buccal mucosa
     Floor of mouth
     Gum (gingiva)
     Involvement of both lateral walls through soft palate or base of tongue
     Soft palate
        Inferior surface including uvula 
        NOS
        Superior (nasopharyngeal) surface

    Localized, NOS

**Note 2:**  Mucosal extension to lingual surface of epiglottis from primary tumors of the base of the tongue and vallecular does not constitute invasion of the larynx.
rows:
Tumor more than 4 cm in greatest dimension or extension to 
lingual surface of epiglottis

Epiglottis, lingual surface, plus both lateral walls through soft palate or base of tongue

Epiglottis WITH fixation

Stated as T3
Stated as T4 [NOS] with no other information on extension

Tumor invades any of the following:
Larynx
Deep/extrinsic muscle of tongue, which are: genioglossus, 
hypoglossus, palatoglossus, and styloglossus
Medial pterygoid
Hard palate
Mandible

Hypopharynx NOS
Posterior surface of epiglottis
Pterygoid muscle, NOS
Pyriform sinus
Soft tissue of neck

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades any of the following:
Lateral pterygoid muscle
Pterygoid plates
Lateral nasopharynx
Skull base
Encases carotid artery

Prevertebral fascia/muscle

Base of skull
Bone of skull
Bone, NOS 

Further contiguous extension:
    Anterior 2/3 of tongue
    Parotid gland

Stated as T4b

Unknown;  extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension

Confined to oropharynx, NOS
Localized, NOS

Stated as T1

Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest
dimension
